    version: 0.9

    Form

    Easily create nice looking forms with different styles and layouts.

    Usage

    Add one of the following classes to form controls inside a <form> element to define them.

    Class Description
    .input Add this class to <input> elements.
    .select Add this class to <select> elements.
    .textarea Add this class to <textarea> elements.
    .radio Add this class to <input type="radio"> elements to create radio buttons.
    .checkbox Add this class to <input type="checkbox"> elements to create checkboxes.
    .range Add this class to <input type="range"> elements to create range forms. 
    
							<form>
								<input class="input" type="text">
								<select class="select">
									<option></option>
									<option></option>
								</select>
								<textarea class="textarea"></textarea>
								<input class="radio" type="radio">
								<input class="checkbox" type="checkbox">
								<input class="range" type="range">
							</form>

    Add the .fieldset class to a <fieldset> element and the .legend class to a <legend> element to define a fieldset and a form legend.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Legend 
    
									<form>
										<fieldset class="fieldset flex flex-col gap-md">

											<legend class="legend">Legend</legend>

											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="Input" aria-label="Input">

											<select class="select" aria-label="Select">
												<option>Option 01</option>
												<option>Option 02</option>
											</select>

											<textarea class="textarea" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea" aria-label="Textarea"></textarea>

											<div class="flex flex-row gap-md">
												<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio2" checked> A</label>
												<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio2"> B</label>
											</div>
											<div class="flex flex-row gap-md">
												<label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" checked> A</label>
												<label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox"> B</label>
											</div>
											
											<input class="range" type="range" value="2" min="0" max="10" step="0.1" aria-label="Range">

										</fieldset>
									</form>

    States modifiers

    Provide the user with basic information through feedback states on form controls by using one of the following classes.

    Class Description
    .form-danger Add this class to notify the user that the value is not validated.
    .form-success Add this class to notify the user that the value is validated.

    Add the disabled attribute to a form control. It will appear muted.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form class="form-stacked">
										
										<input class="input form-danger form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="form-danger" aria-label="form-danger" value="form-danger">
										<input class="input form-success form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="form-success" aria-label="form-success" value="form-success">
										<input class="input form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="disabled" aria-label="disabled" value="disabled" disabled>

									</form>

    Size modifiers

    Add one of the classes to an <input>, <select> or <textarea> element to modify its size.

    Class Description
    .form-large Add this class to make the element larger.
    .form-small Add this class to make the element smaller.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form class="form-stacked">
										<input class="input form-width-medium form-large" type="text" placeholder="Large" aria-label="Large">
										<input class="input form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="Default" aria-label="Default">
										<input class="input form-width-medium form-small" type="text" placeholder="Small" aria-label="Small">
									</form>

    Width modifiers

    Add one of the following classes to an <input>, <select> or <textarea> element to adjust its width.

    Class Description
    .form-width-large Applies a width of 500px.
    .form-width-medium Applies a width of 200px.
    .form-width-small Applies a width of 130px.
    .form-width-xsmall Applies a width of 40px.
    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form class="form-stacked">
											<input class="input form-width-large" type="text" placeholder="Large" aria-label="Large">
											<input class="input form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="Medium" aria-label="Medium">
											<input class="input form-width-small" type="text" placeholder="Small" aria-label="Small">
											<input class="input form-width-xsmall" type="text" placeholder="X-Small" aria-label="X-Small">
									</form>

    You can also apply the .width-* classes from the Width component to form controls.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form>
										<input class="input width-1-3" type="text" placeholder="width-1-3" aria-label="width-1-3">
									</form>

    Blank modifier

    Add the .form-blank class to minimize the styling of form controls.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form>
										<input class="input form-blank form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="Form blank">
									</form>

    Helper text

    Use the .form-help-inline class to provide additional guidance or context for inputs. Place it inside .form-controls for consistent alignment and styling.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    The .form-help-inline class creates spacing to the left.

    The .form-help-inline class creates an associated paragraph.

    
									<form class="form-stacked padding">

										<div class="form-group">
											<input type="text" placeholder="Text input" class="input form-width-large" data-input>
											<span class="form-help-inline">The <code>.form-help-inline</code> class creates spacing to the left.</span>
										</div>

										<div class="form-group">
											<textarea cols="30" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea" class="textarea form-width-large" data-input></textarea>
											<p class="form-help-block">The <code>.form-help-block</code> class creates an associated paragraph.</p>
										</div>

									</form>

    Form layout

    Forms use a flexbox-based layout with consistent spacing between labels, inputs, and help text. Layout modifiers can be applied to the parent .form-horizontal or .form-stacked container. You can also scope layouts per <fieldset> to mix horizontal and stacked sections within the same form.

    Class Description
    .form-horizontal Default layout. Labels are displayed in a fixed-width column on the left, and controls are aligned side by side on the right. Fields will wrap on smaller screens.
    .form-stacked Modifier for vertical forms. Labels are placed above their controls, spanning the full width for a tighter stacked appearance.
    .form-group A flex container that groups a label and its control(s). Ensures proper spacing and alignment for both layouts.
    .form-label Defines the form label. In horizontal forms it has a fixed width and aligns with the input text; in stacked forms it expands full-width.
    .form-controls Defines the form control area. Expands to fill remaining space, and stacks inputs with help or error messages vertically.

    Stacked Form Layout

    Use the .form-stacked class to place labels directly above their form controls. This layout is highly responsive, works well on mobile devices, and is easy for users to scan.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Legend
    Form help inline.
    0/150
    This field is required.
    Radio

    

									<form class="form-stacked">	
										<fieldset>

											<legend>Legend</legend>

											<div class="form-group">
												<label for="username-stacked" class="form-label">Input</label>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<input type="text" id="username-stacked" class="input" placeholder="e.g., input">
													<span class="form-help-inline">Form help inline.</span>
												</div>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<label for="bio-stacked" class="form-label">Textarea</label>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<textarea class="textarea" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea" aria-label="Textarea"></textarea>
													<span class="char-counter">0/150</span>
												</div>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<label class="form-label" for="form-stacked-select">Select</label>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<select class="select" id="form-stacked-select">
														<option>Option 01</option>
														<option>Option 02</option>
													</select>
													<span class="form-error-block">This field is required.</span>
												</div>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<div class="form-label">Radio</div>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio1"> Option 01</label><br>
													<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio1"> Option 02</label>
												</div>
											</div>
											
										</fieldset>

									</form>

    Horizontal Form Layout

    Use the .form-horizontal class for a layout where labels are aligned to the left of their corresponding form controls. This is ideal for desktop views or forms with fewer fields.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Legend
    Your public display name.
    0/150
    This field is required. 
    

									<form class="form-horizontal">
										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>

											<div class="form-group">
												<label for="username" class="form-label">Username</label>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<input class="input" type="text" id="username" placeholder="e.g., john.doe">
													<span class="form-help-inline">Your public display name.</span>
												</div>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<label for="bio" class="form-label">Biography</label>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<textarea class="textarea" id="bio" rows="4" placeholder="Tell us about yourself..."></textarea>
													<span class="char-counter">0/150</span>
												</div>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<label for="country" class="form-label">Country</label>
												<div class="form-controls">
													<select id="country" class="select" class="form-danger">
														<option>Select a country...</option>
														<option>Canada</option>
														<option>United States</option>
														<option>United Kingdom</option>
													</select>
													<span class="form-error-block">This field is required.</span>
												</div>
											</div>

										</fieldset>
									</form>

    Form and icons

    You use an icon from the Icon component inside a form. Add the .form-icon class to a <span> element. Group it with an <input> element by adding the .inline class from the Utility component to a container element around both. The icon has to come first in the markup. By default, the icon will be placed on the left side of the form. To change the alignment, add the .form-icon-flip class.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    

									<form class="form-stacked width-1-3">
										<div class="inline">
											<span class="form-icon">
												<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 -960 960 960"><path d="M480-492.92q-57.75 0-95.22-37.47-37.47-37.48-37.47-95.42 0-57.94 37.47-95.22T480-758.31q57.75 0 95.22 37.28t37.47 95.22q0 57.94-37.47 95.42-37.47 37.47-95.22 37.47ZM180-187.69v-75.93q0-32.23 17.08-56.15t44.38-36.77q63.16-28.07 121.76-42.31 58.6-14.23 116.77-14.23 58.16 0 116.47 14.54t121.21 42.27q28.38 12.82 45.35 36.62Q780-295.85 780-263.62v75.93H180Zm45.39-45.39h509.22v-30.54q0-15.61-9.88-29.92-9.88-14.31-25.81-22.46-59-28.69-111.3-40.19-52.3-11.5-107.62-11.5-55.32 0-108.43 11.5-53.11 11.5-111.11 40.19-15.92 8.15-25.5 22.46-9.57 14.31-9.57 29.92v30.54ZM480-538.31q37.46 0 62.38-24.92 24.93-24.92 24.93-62.38 0-37.47-24.93-62.39-24.92-24.92-62.38-24.92T417.62-688q-24.93 24.92-24.93 62.39 0 37.46 24.93 62.38 24.92 24.92 62.38 24.92Zm0-87.3Zm0 392.53Z"/></svg>
											</span>
											<input class="input" type="text" aria-label="Not clickable icon">
										</div>
										<div class="inline">
											<span class="form-icon form-icon-flip">
												<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 -960 960 960"><path d="M237.69-100q-23.59 0-40.64-17.05T180-157.69v-400.15q0-23.9 17.05-40.8t40.64-16.9h69.62v-91.77q0-71.89 50.44-122.29Q408.19-880 480.13-880q71.95 0 122.25 50.4 50.31 50.4 50.31 122.29v91.77h69.62q23.59 0 40.64 16.9t17.05 40.8v400.15q0 23.59-17.05 40.64T722.31-100H237.69Zm0-45.39h484.62q5.38 0 8.84-3.46t3.46-8.84v-400.15q0-5.39-3.46-8.85t-8.84-3.46H237.69q-5.38 0-8.84 3.46t-3.46 8.85v400.15q0 5.38 3.46 8.84t8.84 3.46ZM480.17-290q27.98 0 47.79-19.53t19.81-47.01q0-26.54-19.98-47.77-19.97-21.23-47.96-21.23-27.98 0-47.79 21.23t-19.81 48.27q0 27.04 19.98 46.54 19.97 19.5 47.96 19.5ZM352.69-615.54h254.62v-91.77q0-53.04-37.09-90.17t-90.08-37.13q-52.99 0-90.22 37.13t-37.23 90.17v91.77Zm-127.3 470.15v-424.76 424.76Z"/></svg>
											</span>
											<input class="input" type="text" aria-label="Not clickable icon">
										</div>
									</form>

    Clickable icons

    To enable an action, for example opening a modal to pick an image or link, use an <a> or <button> element to create the icon.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form class="form-stacked width-1-3">

										<div class="inline">
											<span class="form-icon">
												<a href="#!">
													<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 -960 960 960"><path d="M480-492.92q-57.75 0-95.22-37.47-37.47-37.48-37.47-95.42 0-57.94 37.47-95.22T480-758.31q57.75 0 95.22 37.28t37.47 95.22q0 57.94-37.47 95.42-37.47 37.47-95.22 37.47ZM180-187.69v-75.93q0-32.23 17.08-56.15t44.38-36.77q63.16-28.07 121.76-42.31 58.6-14.23 116.77-14.23 58.16 0 116.47 14.54t121.21 42.27q28.38 12.82 45.35 36.62Q780-295.85 780-263.62v75.93H180Zm45.39-45.39h509.22v-30.54q0-15.61-9.88-29.92-9.88-14.31-25.81-22.46-59-28.69-111.3-40.19-52.3-11.5-107.62-11.5-55.32 0-108.43 11.5-53.11 11.5-111.11 40.19-15.92 8.15-25.5 22.46-9.57 14.31-9.57 29.92v30.54ZM480-538.31q37.46 0 62.38-24.92 24.93-24.92 24.93-62.38 0-37.47-24.93-62.39-24.92-24.92-62.38-24.92T417.62-688q-24.93 24.92-24.93 62.39 0 37.46 24.93 62.38 24.92 24.92 62.38 24.92Zm0-87.3Zm0 392.53Z"/></svg>
												</a>
											</span>
											<input class="input" type="text" aria-label="Clickable icon">
										</div>

										<div class="inline">
											<span class="form-icon form-icon-flip">
												<a href="#!">
													<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 -960 960 960"><path d="M237.69-100q-23.59 0-40.64-17.05T180-157.69v-400.15q0-23.9 17.05-40.8t40.64-16.9h69.62v-91.77q0-71.89 50.44-122.29Q408.19-880 480.13-880q71.95 0 122.25 50.4 50.31 50.4 50.31 122.29v91.77h69.62q23.59 0 40.64 16.9t17.05 40.8v400.15q0 23.59-17.05 40.64T722.31-100H237.69Zm0-45.39h484.62q5.38 0 8.84-3.46t3.46-8.84v-400.15q0-5.39-3.46-8.85t-8.84-3.46H237.69q-5.38 0-8.84 3.46t-3.46 8.85v400.15q0 5.38 3.46 8.84t8.84 3.46ZM480.17-290q27.98 0 47.79-19.53t19.81-47.01q0-26.54-19.98-47.77-19.97-21.23-47.96-21.23-27.98 0-47.79 21.23t-19.81 48.27q0 27.04 19.98 46.54 19.97 19.5 47.96 19.5ZM352.69-615.54h254.62v-91.77q0-53.04-37.09-90.17t-90.08-37.13q-52.99 0-90.22 37.13t-37.23 90.17v91.77Zm-127.3 470.15v-424.76 424.76Z"/></svg>
												</a>
											</span>
											<input class="input" type="text" aria-label="Not clickable icon">
										</div>

									</form>

    Form and grid

    You can also use the Grid and Width components to define the layout of a form.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<form class="grid">
										<div class="col-6-6">
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="100" aria-label="100">
										</div>
										<div class="col-3-6">
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="50" aria-label="50">
										</div>
										<div class="col-2-6">
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="30" aria-label="30">
										</div>
										<div class="col-1-6">
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="20" aria-label="20">
										</div>
										<div class="col-3-6">
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="50" aria-label="50">
										</div>
										<div class="col-3-6">
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="50" aria-label="50">
										</div>
									</form>

    Form error messages

    Use .form-error-block for a single error message below an input, or .form-errors-list when displaying multiple validation errors. Apply .filled to .form-errors-list to make it visible.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    This field is required.
    • Password must be at least 8 characters.
    • Must contain at least one number.
    • Must contain at least one special character.

    Custom controls

    To replace a file inputs or select forms with your own HTML content, like a button or text, add the form-custom attribute to a container element.

    File

    Use a button or text as a file input.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Click here to upload 
    
									<form class="form-stacked padding-horizontal">

										<div class="form-group">
											<label class="form-label">Button Upload</label>
											<div class="form-custom">
												<input type="file" aria-label="Custom controls">
												<button class="button button-default round" type="button" tabindex="-1">Select</button>
											</div>
										</div>

										<div class="form-group">
											<label class="form-label">Text Upload</label>
											<div class="form-custom">
												<input type="file" aria-label="Custom controls">
												<span class="link">Click here to upload</span>
											</div>
										</div>

										<div class="form-group">
											<label class="form-label">Input Upload</label>
											<div class="form-custom">
												<input type="file" aria-label="Custom controls">
												<input class="input form-width-medium" type="text" placeholder="Select file" aria-label="Custom controls" disabled="">
											</div>
										</div>
										
									</form>

    Select

    Use a button, text or a link as a select form. Just add the target: SELECTOR option to the form-custom attribute to select where the option value should be displayed. target: true will select the adjacent element in the markup.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Option 01
    Option 01 
    
									<form class="form-stacked padding-horizontal">	

										<div class="form-group">
											<label class="form-label">Select text</label>
											<div class="form-custom">
												<select aria-label="Custom controls">
													<option value="1">Option 01</option>
													<option value="2">Option 02</option>
													<option value="3">Option 03</option>
													<option value="4">Option 04</option>
												</select>
												<span>Option 01</span>
											</div>
										</div>

										<div class="form-group">
											<label class="form-label">Select with icon</label>
											<div class="form-custom">
												<select aria-label="Custom controls">
													<option value="1">Option 01</option>
													<option value="2">Option 02</option>
													<option value="3">Option 03</option>
													<option value="4">Option 04</option>
												</select>
												<span class="link">
													<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 -960 960 960"><path d="M185.39-185.39h40.92l468.54-467.92-40.93-40.92-468.53 467.92v40.92ZM140-140v-104.54l561.92-562.07q6.23-5.63 14.66-9.2 8.42-3.57 17.6-3.57 8.57 0 16.81 3.34 8.24 3.35 15.32 9.43l40.92 40.92q6.69 6.69 9.73 15.16 3.04 8.46 3.04 16.93 0 8.6-3.51 17.33-3.5 8.73-9.26 14.96L244.54-140H140Zm634.38-594.31-39.46-39.07 39.46 39.07Zm-99.75 60.68-20.71-20.6 40.93 40.92-20.22-20.32Z"/></svg>
													<span>Option 01</span>
												</span>
											</div>
										</div>

										<div class="form-group">
											<label class="form-label">Select Button</label>
											<div class="form-custom">
												<select aria-label="Custom controls">
													<option value="">Please select...</option>
													<option value="1">Option 01</option>
													<option value="2">Option 02</option>
													<option value="3">Option 03</option>
													<option value="4">Option 04</option>
												</select>
												<button class="button button-default" type="button" tabindex="-1">
													<span>Please select...</span>
													<span>
														<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" viewBox="0 -960 960 960"><path d="M480-357.85 253.85-584l32.61-32.61L480-423.08l193.54-193.53L706.15-584 480-357.85Z"/></svg>
													</span>
												</button>
											</div>
										</div>

									</form>

    Data attribute inputs

    Use the [data-input] attribute to apply enhanced input styling and automatic wrapper generation. When applied, inputs are wrapped in an .input-wrapper, labels are repositioned, and either an underline bar or outline style is added depending on the attribute value. This provides a consistent, Material-like input appearance without requiring manual markup.

    Underlined inputs

    Inputs with [data-input] default to an underlined style. Each input is wrapped in an .input-wrapper with a subtle underline bar that highlights on focus, providing a clean and modern appearance.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Legend
    0 / 30

    Radio boxes (CSS)

    Checkboxes (CSS)

    Switch (CSS)

    
									<form class="form-stacked padding">

										<fieldset class="fieldset">
											<legend class="legend">Legend</legend>

											<div class="form-group">
												<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="Input ..." data-counter-id="name-count" data-input>
												<small id="name-count" class="char-counter">0 / 30</small>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<textarea class="textarea" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea ..." data-input></textarea>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<textarea class="textarea autosize" rows="3" placeholder="Autosize textarea ..." data-input></textarea>
											</div>

											<div class="form-group">
												<select class="select">
													<option>Option 01</option>
													<option>Option 02</option>
												</select>
											</div>

											<hr>

											<div class="grid col-3">
												<div>
													<p class="margin-small-bottom text-center">Radio boxes (CSS)</p>
													<div class="grid col-4 gap-none">
														<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio2">A</label>
														<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio2" checked>B</label>
														<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio2c" disabled>C</label>
														<label><input class="radio" type="radio" name="radio2d" checked disabled>D</label>
													</div>
												</div>
												<div>
													<p class="margin-small-bottom text-center">Checkboxes (CSS)</p>
													<div class="grid col-4 gap-none">
														<label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" checked>A</label>
														<label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox">B</label>
														<label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" disabled>C</label>
														<label><input class="checkbox" type="checkbox" checked disabled>D</label>
													</div>
												</div>
												<div>
													<p class="margin-mini-bottom text-center">Switch (CSS)</p>
													<div>
														<input type="checkbox" class="switch-input" id="switch-css">
														<label for="switch-css" class="switch-label">
															Switch
															<span class="switch-toggle-on">On</span>
															<span class="switch-toggle-off">Off</span>
														</label>
													</div>
												</div>
											</div>

										</fieldset>
									</form>

    Outlined inputs

    Add data-input="outline" to use an outlined style instead of the default underline. The input is wrapped in .input-wrapper-outline for consistent spacing and label alignment, giving it a distinct boxed look.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    
									<div class="grid col-2 padding">

										<div>
											<label>Label</label>
											<input class="input" type="text" data-input="outline">
										</div>

										<div>
											<label>Label</label>
											<textarea class="textarea" rows="5" data-input="outline"></textarea>
										</div>

										<div>
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="Input ..." data-input="outline">
										</div>

										<div>
											<textarea class="textarea" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea ..." data-input="outline"></textarea>
										</div>

										<div>
											<label>Label</label>
											<input class="input form-danger" type="text" data-input="outline">
										</div>

										<div>
											<label>Label</label>
											<input class="input form-success" type="text" data-input="outline">
										</div>

									</div>

    Form fieldset separation

    Use the native <fieldset> element to group and separate related form fields, instead of relying on .form-group.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Legend 0 / 30
    Legend
    Legend
    Legend 
    
									<form class="form-stacked padding">

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<input class="input" type="text" placeholder="Input ..." data-counter-id="name-count" data-input>
											<small id="name-count" class="char-counter">0 / 30</small>
										</fieldset>

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<textarea class="textarea" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea ..." data-input></textarea>
										</fieldset>

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<textarea class="textarea autosize" rows="3" placeholder="Autosize textarea ..." data-input></textarea>
										</fieldset>

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<select class="select">
												<option>Option 01</option>
												<option>Option 02</option>
											</select>
										</fieldset>

									</form>

    Form fieldset borders

    Add the .fieldset-border class to display a border around fieldsets. The border style is controlled with the --fieldset-border design token.

    • Preview
    • Markup
    Legend 0 / 30
    Legend
    Legend
    Legend 
    
									<form class="flex flex-col gap-md fieldset-border padding">

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<input class="input form-blank" type="text" placeholder="Input ..." data-counter-id="name-count" data-input>
											<small id="name-count" class="char-counter">0 / 30</small>
										</fieldset>

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<textarea class="textarea form-blank" rows="5" placeholder="Textarea ..." data-input></textarea>
										</fieldset>

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<textarea class="textarea autosize" rows="3" placeholder="Autosize textarea ..." data-input></textarea>
										</fieldset>

										<fieldset>
											<legend>Legend</legend>
											<select class="select">
												<option>Option 01</option>
												<option>Option 02</option>
											</select>
										</fieldset>

									</form>
